dreisoft.tresos.guidedconfig.api.gui.form

Class SWTTableController

  • java.lang.Object
    • dreisoft.tresos.guidedconfig.api.gui.form.AbstractWidgetController
      • dreisoft.tresos.guidedconfig.api.gui.form.AbstractMementoWidgetController
        • dreisoft.tresos.guidedconfig.api.gui.form.SWTTableController

  • public class SWTTableController
extends AbstractMementoWidgetController
    The SWTTableController provides data access and integration into the Guided Config Framework for the SWTTable .

    The SWTTableController serves the following functionality:

    • Provides values, colors and icons for the table cells
    • Dispatches changes to the table model triggered by editing the table to the Guided Configuration engine
    • Dispatches update view and update data requests to the GUI of the table
    • Provides a convenient interface to manage the memento model of the table without the need to consider the actual structure of the model
    • Manages persistence of the meta-data of the table (column visibility, column width)

    Copyright (C) Elektrobit Automotive GmbH - All rights reserved

    Since:
    2009.a

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  SWTTableController.AbstractRowFilter
      This class can be implemented to provide a filter that allows to only show specific rows in the table.

      • isFilteringRows

        public boolean isFilteringRows()
        This method can be overridden in rows should be filtered.

        To filter rows implements filterRow(int).

        The default implementation returns false.

        Returns:
        if a row filter should be applied
        Since:
        2009.a

      • filterRow

        public boolean filterRow(int row)
        This method is queried when a row should be shown to find out if the row should show up in the GUI.

        The default implementation returns false, so no row is shown by default.

        Parameters:
        row - The row to examine
        Returns:
        true if the row should be shown, false if not.
        Since:
        2009.a

      • doGetNumberOfRows

        public int doGetNumberOfRows()
        Get the number of rows the table shows (before filtering)

        The default implementation returns the number of mementos beneath the table memento-

        Returns:
        The number of rows to hand to the table
        Since:
        2009.a

      • doGetCellText

        public java.lang.String doGetCellText(int row,
                                      int column)
        Get the text that should be shown in a table cell.
        Parameters:
        row - The row of the cell starting with 0 in the upper left corner
        column - The column of the cell starting with 0 meaning the first column after the index column
        Returns:
        The text to show (not null)
        Since:
        2009.a

      • doGetCellError

        public boolean doGetCellError(int row,
                              int column)
        Query if the cell has an error marker.

        Error markers are derrived from errors handed in by doUpdateValidationResults(List).

        Parameters:
        row - The row of the cell starting with 0 in the upper left corner
        column - The column of the cell starting with 0 meaning the first column after the index column
        Returns:
        true if the cell has errors
        Since:
        2009.a

      • doGetCellWarning

        public boolean doGetCellWarning(int row,
                                int column)
        Query if the cell has a warning marker.

        Warning markers are derrived from warnings handed in by doUpdateValidationResults(List).

        Parameters:
        row - The row of the cell starting with 0 in the upper left corner
        column - The column of the cell starting with 0 meaning the first column after the index column
        Returns:
        true if the cell has warnings
        Since:
        2009.a

        Returns:

      • doAddRow

        public void doAddRow()
        Adds a new row to the end of the table by starting a coresponding operation via the MementoOperationHandler.

        This method is called when the add button or curresponding operations are triggered from thre GUI.

        Since:
        2009.a

      • doInsertRow

        public void doInsertRow(int row)
        Inserts a new row at the given row of the table by starting a coresponding operation via the MementoOperationHandler.

        This operations is currently unused and calls doAddRow().

        Parameters:
        row - The position at which to add the new one
        Since:
        2009.a

      • doDuplicateRows

        public void doDuplicateRows(int[] rows,
                            int toRow)
        Duplicates the given rows and adds the newly created at the position given by toRow by issuing the corresponding operation via the MementoOperationHandler.

        The method is called when the duplicate button is pressed in the toolbar of the table.

        Parameters:
        rows - The rows to copy
        toRow - the row to add at (currently unused, rows are added at the end!)
        Since:
        2009.a

      • doRemoveRows

        public void doRemoveRows(int[] rows)
        Removes the given rows from the table by issuing the corresponding operation via the MementoOperationHandler.

        This method is called when the delete button is pressed in the GUI.

        Parameters:
        rows -
        Since:
        2009.a

      • doMoveRows

        public void doMoveRows(int[] rows,
                       int direction)
        Moves the given rows up or down (increasing or decreasing row index-) by issuing the corresponding operation via the MementoOperationHandler.

        This method is called when the up or down button in the toolbar of the table is pressed.

        Parameters:
        rows - The rows to move
        direction - the direction (negative for up, positive for down), use DIRECTION_DOWN or DIRECTION_UP
        Since:
        2009.a

      • doSetCellValue

        public void doSetCellValue(int row,
                           int column,
                           java.lang.String value)
        Changes the value of a cell by issuing a corresponding operation via the MementoOperationHandler.

        This method is called when the value of a cell is edited in the table.

        This operation only works if the given row already exists.

        Parameters:
        row - The row of the cell starting with 0 in the upper left corner
        column - The column of the cell starting with 0 meaning the first column after the index column
        value - the new value
        Since:
        2009.a

      • getColumnMementoPaths

        protected java.util.List<java.lang.String> getColumnMementoPaths()
        Get the mementos of the columns as defined with SWTColumnDescription.getMementoId().

        This method does not return a path to the index column so the first entry is the pat to the memento after the index column.

        Returns:
        Paths relative to the row memento that point to the column memento attributes
        Since:
        2009.a

      • getRowIndex

        protected int getRowIndex(Memento memento)
        Get the row index for the given memento.
        Returns:
        the row or -1 if the memento is not a row and not part of a row

      • getRowMemento

        public Memento getRowMemento(int row)
        Get the row memento for the given row index by querying the table memento.
        Parameters:
        row - The row of the cell starting with 0 in the upper left corner
        Since:
        2009.a

      • getRowPath

        public java.lang.String getRowPath(int row)
        Get the memento path to the given row.

        The row does not need to exist.

        Parameters:
        row - The row of the cell starting with 0 in the upper left corner
        Returns:
        the path to the row
        Since:
        2009.a

      • getColumnDescription

        protected SWTColumnDescription getColumnDescription(int column)
        Fetch the column description for the given column from the SWTTable.
        Parameters:
        column - The column of the cell starting with 0 meaning the first column after the index column
        Returns:
        The SWTColumnDescription of the column or null if column is out of bounds
        Since:
        2009.a

      • getCellPath

        public java.lang.String getCellPath(int row,
                                    int column)
        Get the memento path to the given cell.

        The cell does not need to exist.

        Parameters:
        row - The row of the cell starting with 0 in the upper left corner
        column - The column of the cell starting with 0 meaning the first column after the index column
        Returns:
        the path to the cell
        Since:
        2009.a
